head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Thursday, April 16, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Thursday, April 16, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I hope you had a chance to enjoy the beuatiful sunshine today! Two quick updates: April 20th Board Meeting - The School Board will be meeting virtually on Monday at 6 pm. You can watch it live via our Facebook page and you can submit public comments by emailing them to speakers@rvaschools.net (mailto:speakers@rvaschools.net). Please send them in by noon on Monday so they can be turned into a PDF and posted on Board Docs. Thanks! Computer Distribution – As I shared yesterday, we'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Here's all the info: Which students will receive this next batch of computers and hot-spots? Any RPS 9th-11th grader who already signed up for a device using the online form AND any senior who signed up but was unable to come on Monday. If you have not signed up yet, you can do so here. When will middle school and elementary school students receive their computers and hot-spots? As soon as we're done with high school students, we'll move on to middle school and elementary school students. Thank you for your patience! If I'm a 9th-11th
meta.name: description

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Thursday, April 16, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I hope you had a chance to enjoy the beuatiful sunshine today! Two quick updates: April 20th Board Meeting - The School Board will be meeting virtually on Monday at 6 pm. You can watch it live via our Facebook page and you can submit public comments by emailing them to speakers@rvaschools.net (mailto:speakers@rvaschools.net). Please send them in by noon on Monday so they can be turned into a PDF and posted on Board Docs. Thanks! Computer Distribution – As I shared yesterday, we'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Here's all the info: Which students will receive this next batch of computers and hot-spots? Any RPS 9th-11th grader who already signed up for a device using the online form AND any senior who signed up but was unable to come on Monday. If you have not signed up yet, you can do so here. When will middle school and elementary school students receive their computers and hot-spots? As soon as we're done with high school students, we'll move on to middle school and elementary school students. Thank you for your patience! If I'm a 9th-11th

div.span: I hope you had a chance to enjoy the beuatiful sunshine today! Two quick updates:

div.span: April 20th Board Meeting - The School Board will be meeting virtually on Monday at 6 pm. You can watch it live via our Facebook page and you can submit public comments by emailing them to speakers@rvaschools.net. Please send them in by noon on Monday so they can be turned into a PDF and posted on Board Docs. Thanks!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: – As I shared yesterday, we'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Here's all the info:

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.strong: Which students will receive this next batch of computers and hot-spots?

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Any RPS 9th-11th grader who already signed up for a device using the online form AND any senior who signed up but was unable to come on Monday.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: If you have not signed up yet, you can do so here.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.strong: When will middle school and elementary school students receive their computers and hot-spots?

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: As soon as we're done with high school students, we'll move on to middle school and elementary school students. Thank you for your patience!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.strong: If I'm a 9th-11th grader, where do I go to pick up my computer and/or hot-spot?

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Armstrong HS (for 9th-11th graders from Armstrong and Franklin Military)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Huguenot HS (for 9th-11th graders from Huguenot only)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Marshall HS (for 9th-11th graders from Marshall, Community, TJ, Open, RAS, and RCEEA)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Wyth HS (for 9th-11th graders from Wythe only)

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.strong: What day am I supposed to go?

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 10th Graders: Tuesday, April 21

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 9th Graders: Thursday, April 23

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Note: If you can't make your assigned date, you can go to one of the others.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 9:30 am (for last names starting with the letters A-D)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 10:15 am (for last names starting with the letters E-J)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 11:00 am (for last names starting with the letters K-R)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 11:45 am (or last names starting with the letters S-Z)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Note: These time windows are intended to help with social distancing so we respectfully request that students do everything possible to adhere to them. That said, we will not turn away anyone who comes outside their designated time.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.strong: What do I need to bring?

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: We need a parent/caregiver to sign our standard user agreement, available in English and Spanish. If a parent/caregiver cannot come, a student may come on their own as long as they bring a signed agreement with them. These forms will be available at all of the computer pick-up sites, and you can also get them from our website and our food sites.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Your student ID# (which can be found on your report card and transcript)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: A mask or face covering

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Each distribution site will have two pick-up options: in the building and curbside.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: The process of signing out a computer and/or hotspot will take about 15 minutes per student. Each device needs to be powered up and the student then needs to log in to make sure everything is working properly. Parents/caregivers may come without their student but they will need to be able to log on with their student's ID# and password. Given this, we strongly encourage students to come.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Everyone on the distribution team will be wearing masks and gloves, and will have disinfectant wipes for the devices and hand sanitizer for anyone who needs it.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: As always, if you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me at jkamras@rvaschools.net.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
border-bottom: #929292 solid 1px

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Shout-outs! – Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I'd like to shout out my mom, Tiana Addai-Mensah. Since school closed, she's been on me about doing my work since to graduate this year. She is constantly glued to the computer and iPad making videos for her students and others that are out of school. She says she wants to be like the guy from Reading Rainbow. I find this brilliant because not everyone can go to the library but everyone has access to YouTube. She started her "Social Distance Storytime: MJMC Presents" so that her students could still hear her voice. I hear it all day, so I suppose everybody else should too. LOL. Seriously, since all this has taken place, librarians don't have as much to do, but I am proud of her for going above and beyond.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Amy Wentz has been a major help to our families of RPS, especially at Blackwell Elementary, where she's helped my students' families get hot meals from restaurants.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I'd like to give a Special Shout out to Ms. Eunice Turkson at Fairfield Court for calling every week to check on my son to make sure he's doing some studying and has everything he needs while out of school. Thank you, Ms.Turkson. You're a very special lady and teacher and I hope to see you soon. Be safe and stay blessed.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I’d like to give a shout out to Patrick Ambrose from Technology Services. My laptop stopped working during this unfortunate time. As a teacher, I need my laptop in order to stay connected with my students. He has been so helpful!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I'd like to shout out Darryl Williams, a coordinator in the Office of Engagement, for working hard to coordinate all of the non-food items across the RPS distribution sites. Under his coordination, thousands of items like diapers, art supplies, and SOL packets are being distributed to students and families. I'd also like to shout out Will Keenan, a specialist in the same office, for responding so quickly and thoroughly to the volunteer needs on the ground. He recently led recruitment for 30+ volunteers within 18 hours to prep laptops for distribution.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would love to shoutout my daughter's teachers, Ms. Mason and Ms. Bradley from Broad Rock Elementary School, for continuing to help her. Y'all the real MVPs!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: A huge shoutout to the team of Dr. Emily Stanford, Ms. Rahmah Johnson, Mrs. Lanae Dowe, Ms. Crystal Potee and Mrs. Cherita Sears at Thomas Jefferson High School for the prompt response and assistance with getting my son's RPS@Home lessons and supports in place. All of them readily offered personal phone numbers to assist him...Thomas Jefferson High School staff have been awesome in contacting my children and helping them understand the expectations of the RPS@Home lessons. They saved quite a few grey hairs for me today!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Thank you to Mr. John Camejo of Thomas Jefferson High School for texting to see if my son needed any assistance with his Spanish I RPS@Home module. He offered to text or talk with my son about any questions he may have. What a great gesture!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I am a parent and wanted to give a shout out to Ms. Demlein from JL Francis. She has been keeping up with her students and their parents through classroom dojo since the first day school closed. She made sure we had resources for ongoing learning even before the online curriculum was uploaded and makes videos of her reading chapters from the school wide book every week. Also, I wanted to shout out the teacher who makes the Kindergarten math video lessons. I can't find her name on the website, but she does a good job of engaging the children through the video. My kindergarten age foster son works the problems out with me on his white board and then holds his board up to the computer to show the teacher while we watch the video of her explaining the answers. Even through video she has made an impression and he is eager to try out the problems so that he can hold them up for her to check.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Robin Majer, 2nd grade teacher at Cary, is continuing Zoom story time and chats weekly. She also uses the RPS@Home resources and enjoys the lessons. Ketia Singleton and Cheri Manning, veteran teachers at Cary, are leading "Coffee and Conversations" with the new teachers over Google hangout. Anna Sickinger and Emily McAllister are writing letters to EACH of their students in their classroom. Acknowledging our exceptional education teachers who are continuing to meet their deadlines and collaborate with their parents. We also now have parent signatures through Parent Portal. Thank you, Renesha, Rossi, Amir, and Tikisha!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I cannot say enough about the fantastic Kindergarten Team at Oak Grove-Bellemeade Elementary School! They continue to make daily videos for their students with a morning meeting, literacy and math lessons, enrichment and stem activities, and read alouds. Each day the video is different and you can tell how much effort they have put into them. I know our students are benefitting from the continued support of their teachers. What an amazing group of ladies!!!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: First, I would like to thank my youngest’s teachers. He is in Mrs. Dejnozka’s 3rd grade at Fox. First off, Mrs. D (as we all call her) sends out daily emails and reminders and gives us little anecdotes on what’s happening at her house with her children...I also want to highlight my child's IEP teachers: Ms. Evans (speech therapy) and Ms. Zinskie (OT). Seeing my child's face light up when his teachers check in on him personally and watching Ms. D’s weekly Friday morning chat session with the class have given us normalcy, which has been much needed during these times. I’d also like to highlight Mrs. Jacobs at Fox, who is checking in through email and keeping the kids engaged.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Next up is Binford and my two oldest. First and foremost, the initial shoutout goes to Ms. Rickey and Mr. Walker. Their weekly phone calls keep us together. My 6th grader has had Zoom meetings and assignments through Google Classrooms with Ms. Hosman, Ms. Hogans-Foster, and Mr. Gruber. And, for my 8th grader, knowing that the modules are up and ready has given him a sense of relief and calm knowing that he can still get his credits. Shout outs for his grade are Mr. Trache, Mr. Regan, and Mr. Self, who are keeping up communication through emails, creating youtube video lessons, and are available night and day for questions.

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
span.span: "Mr. K's 30 Minutes of Math!" – Check out my math lessons at 2 pm every weekdays. I'm focusing on fractions, but every lesson also includes a Math Joke of the Day and a Math Riddle of the Day. You can also view past episodes here!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
border-bottom: #929292 solid 1px

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;line-height: 19.5px
div.span: Important Links – I'll note in orange when there have been additions/updates so you you won't miss anything.
